result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial/scheduling conference on April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Atty Larimore would like to conduct arraignment today. ADA Becker will file information. Atty Larimore enters a NG plea, waives speedy trial. DE is currently on a PO HOLD. Court will schedule for a pre trial conference.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Joshua James Coty appeared from jail. Case called at 3:00 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. Atty Larimore states DE will waive preliminary hearing. Court reviews rights with DE. DE understands and waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial/scheduling conference on March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Maysa C. except for purposes of child exchange for visitation purposes.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
